message.content: This question requires basic knowledge of weather and the effects of clouds on sunlight. On a cloudy day, the clouds block some of the sunlight from reaching the ground. As a result, the sun is less visible compared to a clear day. Option (A) is incorrect because rain can still occur even if it is not visible. Option (B) is incorrect because the presence of clouds indicates that they have not disappeared. Option (C) is incorrect because clouds can actually make the sky appear less blue by blocking some of the sunlight.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of cloud cover on visibility. On a cloudy day, the clouds block some of the sunlight, making the sun less visible. Option (A) is incorrect because rain is not mentioned in the question and its visibility is not related to cloud cover. Option (B) is incorrect because the presence of clouds is mentioned in the question. Option (C) is incorrect because clouds often block sunlight and can make the sky appear gray rather than blue.

This question relates to the effects of clouds on sunlight and visibility. On a cloudy day, the clouds block the sunlight, making the sun less visible. Option (A) is incorrect because rain can still be visible even on cloudy days, especially if it is falling heavily. Option (B) is untrue because clouds are present on a cloudy day. Option (C) is also untrue because the presence of clouds can actually make the sky appear less blue.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of clouds on sunlight. On a cloudy day, the clouds block the sunlight, making the sun less visible. Option (A) is incorrect because rain itself is not invisible, but it may be harder to see falling raindrops on a cloudy day due to reduced visibility. Option (B) is incorrect because if the clouds were gone, it would no longer be a cloudy day. Option (C) is incorrect because the presence of clouds can actually make the sky appear less blue as the clouds block and scatter sunlight.
